maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of RPC filters that match the specified criteria.
This cmdlet retrieves a list of RPC filters that match the specified criteria. If no criteria are specified, all RPC filters on the local computer are returned.
Specifies the unique identifier of the RPC filter provider.

Specifies that only RPC filters created by the Zero Networks RPC Firewall should be returned. This parameter is equivalent to specifying the provider key 17171717-1717-1717-1717-171717171717, which is the unique identifier of the Zero Networks RPC Filter Provider.
Specifies the unique identifier of the RPC filter provider.

Specifies that only RPC filters created by the Zero Networks RPC Firewall should be returned. This parameter is equivalent to specifying the provider key 17171717-1717-1717-1717-171717171717, which is the unique identifier of the Zero Networks RPC Filter Provider.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all RPC filters on the local computer.
Displays all RPC filters in an interactive grid view.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new RPC filter for managing remote procedure call (RPC) traffic based on specified criteria.

This cmdlet creates a new RPC filter for managing remote procedure call (RPC) traffic based on specified criteria. The filter can be customized using various parameters to define its behavior and conditions.
Specifies the action to be performed if all the filter conditions are true.
Indicates whether incoming RPC calls are audited as part of C2 and common criteria compliance. Supported values are Disabled, Enabled, and EnabledWithParams.
The authentication level controls how much security a client or server wants from its SSP.
The match type (operator) for the authentication level.
Authentication service used for RPC connections.
Indicates whether the filter is enforced at boot-time, even before BFE starts.
The identification of the COM application.
Optional filter description.
Unique identifier of the filter.
The name of the application.
The UUID of the RPC interface.
The local IP address.
The local IP address mask.
The local transport protocol port number.
Human-readable RPC filter name.
The name of the remote named pipe.
The RPC operation number for an RPC call made to an RPC listener.
Indicates whether to return the object that was created by the cmdlet.
Indicates whether the filter is persistent, that is, it survives across BFE stop/start.
The remote IP address.
The remote IP address mask.
The identification of the remote user in SDDL form.
Indicates whether to match the security descriptor negatively (i.e., NOT match).
Protocol family used by the RPC endpoint.
The weight indicates the priority of the filter, where higher-numbered weights have higher priorities.
Specifies the action to be performed if all the filter conditions are true.
Indicates whether incoming RPC calls are audited as part of C2 and common criteria compliance. Supported values are Disabled, Enabled, and EnabledWithParams.
The authentication level controls how much security a client or server wants from its SSP.
The match type (operator) for the authentication level.
Authentication service used for RPC connections.
Indicates whether the filter is enforced at boot-time, even before BFE starts.

The identification of the remote user in SDDL form.
Indicates whether to match the security descriptor negatively (i.e., NOT match).
Protocol family used by the RPC endpoint.
The weight indicates the priority of the filter, where higher-numbered weights have higher priorities.
Specifies a well-known RPC protocol. The protocol UUID is derived from the specified value.
Specifies the action to be performed if all the filter conditions are true.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-RpcFilter -Name 'Block-SCMR-NP' -Description 'Block MS-SCMR over Named Pipes' -WellKnownProtocol ServiceControlManager -Transport ncacn_np -Action Block -Audit Enabled

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new RPC filter to block and audit service management (MS-SCMR) traffic over Named Pipes.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an existing remote procedure call (RPC) filter.
This cmdlet removes an existing RPC filter from the system. The filter can be specified by its unique identifier or by passing the filter object directly.
Specifies the identifier of the RPC filter to delete.
Specifies the RPC filter object to delete.
If this switch is specified, the cmdlet returns the deleted RPC filter object. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the identifier of the RPC filter to delete.
Specifies the RPC filter object to delete.
If this switch is specified, the cmdlet returns the deleted RPC filter object. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the RPC filter with the specified identifier.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-RpcFilter | where Name -eq 'Block-EFSRPC' | Remove-RpcFilter -PassThrough

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes RPC filters called 'Block-EFSRPC' and returns the deleted filter objects.
Removes all existing RPC filters from the system.
